cab.content: nnnUMBNT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTYTS GOVERNMENT) .C R E.JT.COPY NO.CABINET 41 (29).Meeting of the Cabinet to be hold at No, 10 downing street, S.W.I., on Friday, October 25th,1929, at 2.50 p,m.AGENDUM.UNEMPLOYMENT POLICY.(Reference Cabinet 40 (29), Conclusion 2).Memorandum by the Lord Privy -Seal,(CP. 287 (29) - circulated herewith).(Signed) M.P.A. HANKEY,Secretary to the Cabinet.hitchall Gardens, S.W.I.October 23rd, 1929. Iggj^a^UMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTYTS GOVERNMENT) .^%jy&JLIL* Copy Ho.cabinet 41 (29).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinet held at10, Downing Street, S.W.1., on FRIDAY,25th October, 1929, at 2.J50 p.m.s * 4PRESENT:-The Right Hon.Philip Snowden, M.P. ,Chancellor of the Exchequer.(Acting Prime Minister).he Right Hon.Arthur Henderson, M.P.,Secretary of State forForeign Affairs.ie Eight Hon.Lord Passfield, Secretary ofState for Dominion Affairs and secretary of State for theColonies .le Right Hon.Lord Sankey, G.B.E.,Lord Chancellor.he Right Hon.W. Wedgwood Benn, D.S.O.,D.F.C.,M.P. , Secretary ofState for India.le Right Hon.Arthur Greenwood, M.P. ,Minister of Health.fhe Right Hon.Noel Buxton, M.P. ,Minister of Agricultureand Fisheries.fhe Right Hon.William Graham, M.P. ,President of the Boardof Trade.he Right Hon.William Adams on,. M.P. ,Secretary of State forScotland.The Right Hon.J.H. Thomas, M.P.,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon.Lord Parmoor of Frieth,K G.V.O., K.C., Lord Presidentof the Council.The Right Hon.J.R. Glynes, M.P., Secretaryof State for Home Affairs.Brig.-Gen. The Right Hon.Lord Thomson, C.B.E.,D.S.O.,Secretary of State forAir.The Right Hon.Margaret Bondfield,Minister of Labour.The Right Hon.Sir Charles Trevelyan, Bt.,M.P., President of theBoard of Education.Hon.The RightA.V. Alexander,..P. , FirstLord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon.George Lansbury, M.P.,First Commissioner ofWorks.Sir M.P.A. Hankey, G.G .B. ,G. CM. G. . . . ........... Secretary, fMENTreviousReference:Cabinet 40C29), Con-flusion 2.;1. The Cabinet held a Special Meeting for thepurpose of discussing Unemployment Policy as awholes They had before them the following documents, which had been circulated by theLord Privy Seal as the Minister in charge ofUnemployment: -A Memorandum (Paper CP.-287 (29)). on Unemployment Policy, by theLord Privy Seal:A Note (Paper CP.-288 (29)) bythe Lord Privy Seal covering aProgress Report prepared forthe inter-Departmental Committeeon Unemployment.After hearing from the Lord Privy Seal a full statement of the Unemployment position, elaborating-and bringing up to date his Memorandum, theCabinet proceeded to a general discussion of thequestion.In the course of this discussion the Lord privy seal undertook to circulate a Memorandum regardingthe planting of unemployed men on the land.Summing up the general results of the disous-sion, the Acting Prime Minister expressed, onbehalf of the Cabinet, strong support to thegeneral lines on which the Lord Privy Seal was proceeding, as set forth in his Memorandum,emphasising that schemes which were to produce a permanent effect in the reduction of unemploy-ment could not be expected to fructify immediately;although as the weeks and months went on theirresults would become apparent. He suggested,however, that the Lord Privy Seal should exerci^the greatest reserve in making use in parliamentary^debate of the arguments in the early part of his memorandum (Paper CP.-287 (29)) in which, the deficiencies of the "live register test" were set forth.The only point which was felt to require futher elucidation was the question of labourtransference, and on this the Cabinet agreed -(a) That a Cabinet Committee, composed as followsi-The Home Secretary (in the Chair),The Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs,The Secretary of State for Air,The First. Lord of the Admiralty,The Minister of Health -should meet as soon as possible toconsider the question of transferredlabour.(b) That the Lord Privy Seal should furnish the above Committee withall material necessary for itsinvestigations. NEXT MEETING 2. The Cabinet agreedOF CABINET.That their next Meeting shouldbe held on -WEDNESDAY next,OCTOBER 30, 1929,, at 10 a.in.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.1,October 25, 1929.-3-
